translation_english: to know (a fact or how to)
example_sentence_english: I want to know the truth.

example_sentence_italian: Sapendo la verità, ho agito diversamente.
example_sentence_english: Knowing the truth, I acted differently.

notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_italian: La notizia saputa da pochi cambiò tutto.
example_sentence_english: The news known by few changed everything.

notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses

translation_english: I knew / I used to know
you knew / you used to know
we knew / we used to know
they knew / they used to know

notes: uses auxiliary 'avere'; past participle does not agree with subject (same form for all genders)
example_sentence_english: I learned/ I have known the news yesterday.
